revised_title: Electrical Problems with Equal Parallel Cylindrical Conductors
tldr: The author solves the electrostatic problem of determining the distribution of charge and potential in parallel cylindrical conductors carrying equal charges. The solution is derived using the method of conjugate functions and is applicable to cases of high-frequency currents. The study provides insights into the potential, charge distribution, repulsion, and capacitance of the conductors, which can be useful in understanding electrical phenomena and designing electrical systems.
